definition: to win top marks in the imperial examinations
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
variant of 榜[bang3]
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
surname Ti
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: Ones who recite more have more chances to stand out.
sentences.chinese: 只有背得越多，离金榜题名才越进一步。

sentences.english: He succeeded in the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 他在入学考试中金榜题名了。

sentences.english: I'm glad you passed the test.
sentences.chinese: 知道你金榜题名，我很高兴。

definition: lit. plucking a branch of osmanthus from the Toad Palace (i.e. the moon)/fig. to succeed in the imperial examination
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to be successful in one's studies/academic success
to bring honor to one's ancestors
to pass an exam
to pass the provincial level imperial examination
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
first-placed candidate in the provincial imperial examinations (old)
to go and take an imperial examination
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
to win instant success (idiom)
